intro: Brassica juncea var. oleifera, commonly known as Indian mustard or brown mustard, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate leaves that are lobed or pinnately divided. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by pods containing several seeds. It is native to South Asia and is cultivated for its seeds, which are used in cooking and oil production. The plant is also valued for its nutritional content and traditional medicinal uses.
